page.title: 03OLD BUILDING METHOD DUNSFORD
page.content: Dunsford is a small village on the River Teign.It was there in the Norman times.It probabally started off as a place where people could cross the river.Dunsford has many old houses which ars built of cob and thatch.Cob is a mixture of straw,small stones,mud and dung tightly compacted.The walls are cut with a tool that has a cutting edge at right angles to the handle, called an adze.To thatch a roof is a very long job that requires much skill on the thatcher's part.Each thatcher has his own way of finishing the ridge to show that he has thatched that roof We count old houses as over 100 years old but some are six or seven centuries old.
